intro: Maximowicziella, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Maximowicziella is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in low-water conditions.
